modules.name: artificial_intelligence_applications_in_industry
recommendedLiterature: Various Scientific Publications – details in the lecture slides
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Machine Learning Concepts and Techniques, Programming in Python

modules.name: data_science_in_action
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Knowledge in Data Mining, Machine Learning, Statistics or empirical research methods

modules.name: computational_analysis_of_communication
recommendedLiterature: Computational Analysis of Communication: A practical introduction to the analysis of texts, networks, and images with code examples in Python and R.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basic skills in descriptive and inferential statistics, machine learning, web-scraping/web-mining

modules.name: foundations_and_applications_of_digital_health_technologies
recommendedLiterature: Deep Digital Phenotyping and Digital Twins for Precision Health: Time to Dig Deeper. Journal of Medical Internet Research 22, e16770 (2020).
E-Health. in Digital Transformation (ed. Neugebauer, R.) 311–334 (Springer Berlin Heidelberg, 2019).
Digital technologies in the public-health response to COVID-19. Nat Med 26, 1183–1192 (2020).
The Cambridge Handbook of Responsible Artificial Intelligence: Interdisciplinary Perspectives. Cambridge Law Handbooks. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basic knowledge about AI systems and digital health systems

modules.name: co_creating_digital_health_applications_with_design_methodology
recommendedLiterature: Deep Digital Phenotyping and Digital Twins for Precision Health: Time to Dig Deeper. Journal of Medical Internet Research 22, e16770 (2020).
E-Health. in Digital Transformation (ed. Neugebauer, R.) 311–334 (Springer Berlin Heidelberg, 2019).
Digital technologies in the public-health response to COVID-19. Nat Med 26, 1183–1192 (2020).
The Cambridge Handbook of Responsible Artificial Intelligence: Interdisciplinary Perspectives. Cambridge Law Handbooks. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basic knowledge about AI systems and digital health systems

modules.name: generative_software_engineering
recommendedLiterature: Software engineering (10th ed.) by Ian Sommerville.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Knowledge of Java and/or Python, Software Testing and Experimentation
